issue_comments.body:
I have responded to this from ZeroMe (this post includes an image).

You should have a button on all issues of repos you own labelled "Comment and close issue". It should be right next to the "Comment" button.

Also, technically you can edit other's comments because you are the owner of the repo. This is why the owner of the repo can see the edit button on all comments (in the top right corner of each).

However, if you are on Linux, these icons may not be showing up (I've had problems with this on Linux only, Windows seems to be fine for me)
Clear cache of Git Center. Try that. I've had problems that were fixed by doing that before. Otherwise, idk.

> Since the tags "issue" and "pull_request" are in the newsfeed, Another option would be excluding them from "All" tag. Or making a tag "All except code".

This isn't possible with the current implementation of the ZeroNet NewsFeed plugin. You should create an issue for this on the ZeroNet repo.

This zite wasn't made for users without the knowledge of what Git is and how to use Git hosting providers like GitHub.
If you know how to use Git, then you pretty much know how to use Git Center.

Btw, the terms that you use in a guide are going to be the terms that you use for the repective field you are in. You use the terms framework, cloud, ec. if you are writing a guide *for programmers* - obviously.

If you don't know what cloning is in ZeroNet, then that guide isn't for you... simple as that.
Except that these terms are *concise* terms used by programmers *to communicate to programmers*.

Contrary to what you may think, "bindings" is an actual **concise** word that *means something*. It's not a buzzword like "cloud" is. The same thing goes for "framework" and "library" and "interface".

> Testing a quote


Testing new line
